alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 19 at 9:57PM MDT until April 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL, EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Temperatures will cool significantly overnight, but relative humidity values will be unable to recover much with many zones struggling to reach 25 to 35 percent by Thursday morning. Windy conditions will redevelop Thursday afternoon with very dry air invading the area. This along with another round of unstable conditions will lead to more critical conditions Thursday afternoon, namely across central, east central and northeastern areas of New Mexico. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), Upper Rio Grande and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121) North Central Mountains (Zone 120) below significant snowpack, Sangre de Cristo Mountains below significant snowpack (Zone 122) for noon to 8 pm MDT Thursday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 6 to 12 percent at lower elevations. Around 15 to 22 percent above 8500 feet in the north central and Sangre de Cristo mountains. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
